summary:
- 17 years of independent consulting experience.  Before that, worked in Dutch NGOs (Hivos, Oxfam Novib) and in Africa (Sudan, Mozambique, Angola).
- specializing in the protection of human rights defenders by the EU, EU member states and like-minded countries - supporting more active and effective implementation of policies to support and protect HRDs.
- working with diplomats, human rights defenders, international and local NGOs
- clients have included the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Amnesty International, the European Commission, EuroMed Rights, UNDP, Swiss FDFA Peace and Human Rights Division, Front Line Defenders and Oxfam Novib. 
- design and facilitation of workshops, evaluations, research, lobby and advocacy, writing, strategic advice
- identifying opportunities, devising strategies, consulting stakeholders, assessing needs, working in a team, writing handbooks and manuals
- countries I've focused on or visited include:  Russia, Egypt, Israel/OPT, China, Afghanistan, Krygyzstan and Angola.
- training and capacity-building for diplomats and HRDs
- Theories of Change and Results Frameworks for projects and programmes

profile_positions.description:
•	Research, training, facilitation, advising, strategic planning, evaluation, lobby and advocacy.
•	For the European Commission (2014-2016):  setting up and developing an international network of organizations involved in the temporary relocation of human rights defenders.
•	For Amnesty International:  designing, facilitating and writing reports on workshops bringing together local human rights defenders and EU diplomats in Russia, Turkey and Afghanistan; writing two reports published by Amnesty which made recommendations for the improved implementation of the European Union Guidelines on Human Rights Defenders. 
•	Evaluations:  UNDP's "Civil Society Organizations for Inclusiveness, Democratic Governance and Human Rights" in Israel/OPT (2022), Shelter City Programme of Justice and Peace Netherlands (2018), World Organization Against Torture (2014), International Campaign for Human Rights in Iran (2012-2013), the human rights defenders programme of FORUM-ASIA (2009) and Citizens Against Corruption, Kyrgyzstan (2008).
•	Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territories:  monitoring and reporting on the situation of human rights defenders, lobbying the Dutch Government and the EU to protect human rights defenders, training workshops for human rights defenders in Hebron (February 2014), strategic advice to Kurve Wustrow, a German NGO active in the OPT. 
•	Writing practical lobby and advocacy handbooks for human rights defenders:  two handbooks on EU protection for Front Line Defenders and a training guide and advocacy kit on EU advocacy for the Euro-Mediterranean Human Rights Network.

Further information can be found on my website:  www.chriscollier.nl
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
- Wrote the policy guiding the provision of $12 million per year in funding to over 200 local organizations working on human rights  and democratization in Africa, Asia, Latin America and the Balkans.
- Coordinated and backstopped a team of Human Rights Officers working within different departments of the organization.
- Wrote a specific human rights and democratization policy for Africa
- Carried out field visits in Africa, India and Central America to assess needs, identify projects and evaluate or define intervention strategies.
- Initiated and implemented lobby and advocacy on human rights issues (human rights defenders, Zimbabwe, corruption, etc.) in collaboration with other relevant organizations.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Officer, Human Rights

profile_positions.description:
- Worked as a member of a four-person team managing a total annual budget of approximately $4 million for Angola, Guiné-Bissau and Mozambique.
- Drafted the Novib country policy document for Angola.
- Identified new partner organizations, appraised project proposals, negotiated funding agreements, monitored and arranged for the evaluation of projects.
- Acted as human rights specialist on the East and Southern Africa Desk.
- Stimulated and collaborated in the work of Novib’s lobby and campaign departments’ related to the three countries.
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer for Lusophone Africa
